ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learnt more Portuguese, and about the fight for racial justice in Brazil.
I improved my spoken and written Portuguese. I learned about Afro-Brazilian history through reading classics in Brazilian literature, as well as through listening to music and watching movies.
i gained knowledge about brazilian literature as well as racism in society and the institutions built around us.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course was very engaging, and I loved learning about the culture of Brazil in addition to the language. Perhaps future editions of the course could include cultural aspects from other lusophone countries too.

Strengths: Giseli is a great professor who tries her hardest and is very into the material. She does a good job of keeping the conversation alive when engagement is low. The workload was definitely manageable and I enjoyed working on the final project. There are a lot of opportunities to practice speaking Portuguese, and the class was interactive. Weaknesses: some of the activities seemed forced, especially in-class with the group exercises. Giseli's political views would spill into class discussion, making some days uncomfortable when people disagreed with her. Engagement got lower throughout the semester.

strengths: We were encouraged to always speak!

weaknesses: I felt that we did not have as much time to dive into some works because there was so many.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, it is a fantastic way to improve your Portuguese and the professor is excellent

Yes, I would recommend this course if you want to improve your Portuguese. You get lots of chances to practice writing and speaking, and Giseli is a kind instructor who cares about all her students. The workload is very manageable as well.

I would definitely recommend this course to another student. I love that the Portuguese department at Yale encourages students to enjoy the language learning process and gain a deep appreciation and love for Brazilian culture. The material of this class was fascinating and the readings always led to engaging discussions.
